intro: Urostachys rubricus, commonly known as the red-stemmed rockweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and hairy, reddish stems that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Urostachys rubricus is a perennial species that is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
